title: LA Airbnb Analysis
text:
The ‚ÄúLA Airbnb Analysis‚Äù project aims to analyze Airbnb listings and reviews in Los Angeles. The primary objective is to provide insights and strategies to Airbnb hosts to enhance their performance and profitability. The datasets used are in CSV format, comprising two main datasets: one with 45,591 rows of listings and another with 55,240 reviews. The host analysis focuses on understanding the factors that contribute to a host achieving superhost status. Superhosts are associated with higher profits and more visibility on the platform.
The analysis identifies key predictors, such as response rates, acceptance rates, ratings, profile pictures, and the duration of hosting. Using logistic regression and random forest models, we were able to achieve test accuracies of 74% and 76%, respectively. The analysis suggests that maintaining high ratings, acceptance rates, and response rates, along with continuous hosting, can significantly improve a host‚Äôs chances of becoming a superhost. Strategies recommended include addressing negative reviews, using automated messages, and pre-written responses to maintain high response rates, and leveraging features like instant booking and updated calendars to maintain high acceptance rates.In addition to host analysis, the project also delves into listing analysis using Natural Language Processing (NLP) techniques. Sentiment analysis of reviews helps identify factors contributing to low-rated listings.
The project includes an interactive dashboard for guests, displaying information such as price, room type, and the number of beds, along with filters to help guests find the right listing. Topic modeling using Latent Dirichlet Allocation (LDA) further aids in understanding the themes in guest reviews. Overall, the ‚ÄúLA Airbnb Analysis‚Äù project combines machine learning and NLP to offer actionable insights to Airbnb hosts. By identifying the critical factors for achieving superhost status and understanding guest sentiments, the project provides hosts with strategies to improve their listing visibility and guest satisfaction. The ultimate goal is to help hosts enhance their performance and profitability on the Airbnb platform.

title: Amazon Purchase Predictor Regression Model
text:
In this project, regression analysis was performed based on datasets that contained information about Amazon purchases from the specific demographics of customary, by training the model through the train and test datasets. The primary objective of this project was to predict the response variable log_total, given the explanatory variables from the provided dataset.
From the initial investigation of the datasets, the explanatory variables of count_hh4 and count_G were narrowed, which could have contributed to a strong association of the response variable log_total. These predictions are based on the fact with more orders, there would be an expected positive correlation with the response variable as well. Furthermore, with a larger household and income, it is expected there would be an increase in order volume and total. To understand specific variables affecting the explanatory variable, model evaluation was performed through various data pre-processing, model recipes, and hyperparameters.

title: Amazon Purchase Predictor Regression Model
text: R Random Forest KNN Tidyverse Caret ggplot2

title: Amazon Purchase Predictor Regression Model
text:
Introduction
The Amazon Purchase Predictor Regression Model aims to analyze purchasing behaviors based on demographic and transaction data. The primary goal was to predict log_total, the total spending amount in log scale, using various explanatory variables. By implementing regression techniques, this study identifies key factors influencing customer spending habits and provides insights into consumer behavior.

title: Amazon Purchase Predictor Regression Model
text:
Process
To build the predictive model, the following steps were taken:

Data Preprocessing:

Cleaned and handled missing values.

Normalized and transformed variables where necessary.

Selected relevant features based on correlation and importance.

Model Selection & Training:

Experimented with multiple regression models, including Linear Regression, Ridge Regression, Lasso Regression, Random Forest, and KNN Regression.

Tuned hyperparameters using cross-validation for optimal performance.

Feature Engineering:

Identified key explanatory variables such as count_hh4 (household size) and count_G (order count), which showed a strong correlation with log_total.

Considered interactions between income level and purchasing frequency to refine the model.

title: Amazon Purchase Predictor Regression Model
text:
Outcome
The final model selected was a Random Forest regression model, which achieved:

Root Mean Squared Error (RMSE): 0.1128934

Standard Error (SE): 0.003002182

R¬≤ Score: Higher than 0.9587, indicating strong predictive power.
The results confirmed that household size, order count, and income level were significant predictors of Amazon purchases.

KNN regression was tested but did not outperform tree-based models in terms of accuracy.

title: LA Airbnb Analysis
text:
Introduction
The LA Airbnb Analysis project aims to analyze Airbnb listings and reviews in Los Angeles. The primary objective is to provide insights and strategies to Airbnb hosts to enhance their performance and profitability. The datasets used are in CSV format, comprising two main datasets: one with 45,591 rows of listings and another with 55,240 reviews. The host analysis focuses on understanding the factors that contribute to a host achieving superhost status. Superhosts are associated with higher profits and more visibility on the platform.

title: LA Airbnb Analysis
text:
Process
To build the analysis, the following steps were taken:

Host Analysis:

Analyzed key predictors such as response rates, acceptance rates, ratings, profile pictures, and duration of hosting.
Used logistic regression and random forest models to determine factors contributing to superhost status.

Listing Analysis with NLP:

Applied Natural Language Processing (NLP) to conduct sentiment analysis of reviews.
Used Latent Dirichlet Allocation (LDA) for topic modeling to identify themes in guest reviews.

Dashboard Development:

Created an interactive dashboard displaying important information like price, room type, and the number of beds.
Included filters for guests to easily find the right listing based on their preferences.

title: LA Airbnb Analysis
text:
Outcome
The final analysis revealed that:

Key predictors for achieving superhost status included high ratings, acceptance rates, and response rates.
Test accuracies for logistic regression and random forest models were 74% and 76%, respectively.
Suggested strategies for hosts to improve their chances of becoming superhosts included maintaining high ratings, addressing negative reviews, and using features like instant booking and updated calendars to improve acceptance rates.
Sentiment analysis of reviews helped identify common issues with low-rated listings.

üìä Presentation Slides: Airbnb Analysis

title: To do List
text: Java PostgreSQL JDBC

title: To do List
text:
Introduction
The To-Do List Application is a simple Java-based program that allows users to manage tasks with basic CRUD (Create, Read, Update, Delete) functionality. It uses PostgreSQL as the backend database for task storage and provides an interactive user interface for managing tasks efficiently.

title: To do List
text:
Features

Add Task:

Create a new task with a name, description, due date, and status.

View Tasks:

Retrieve and display all tasks stored in the database.

Update Task:

Modify the task name and status.

Delete Task:

Remove a task from the database permanently.

title: To do List
text:
Outcome
The project successfully implements a task management system with fundamental database operations. Future enhancements may include:

User authentication for personalized task management

Task filtering and sorting by due date or priority

Integration with a front-end interface for a better user experience


Links
üìÇ Project Repository: GitHub - To-Do List Application

title: To do List
text:
Process
To develop the To-Do List Application, the following steps were taken:

Database Setup:

Designed a PostgreSQL database schema with a tasks table.

Defined columns for task ID, name, description, due date, and status.

JDBC Integration:

Established a JDBC connection to interact with the PostgreSQL database.

Implemented SQL queries for inserting, retrieving, updating, and deleting tasks.

Backend Development:

Created a Java application with CRUD operations.

Used Prepared Statements to prevent SQL injection.

User Interface Implementation:

Developed a console-based UI for task management.

Provided user-friendly prompts for adding, viewing, updating, and deleting tasks.

Testing & Debugging:

Tested database interactions with sample task entries.

Debugged connection issues and ensured data integrity.
